alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 11:28PM CDT until June 10 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Carson and Gray. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1127 PM CDT, The heavy rain has ended. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Groom and Lefors. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
